column2: Bandits have been seen plundering the trade route and killing the merchants.
Send some of your best soldiers to patrol the area
A merchant walks to you saying that some of his goods have been stolen when he was selling them on your trade post. He demands compensation for the stolen goods.
Send this peasant away from me
Merchants are complaining that a thriving black market is present in your trading post, they sell goods at far lower prices but with questionable quality.
More trade, more money... Tax it!
Apparently your trading policies have attracted more traders somehow.
This winter has been particularly harsh on the trade, many merchants are stuck on the roads due to the insane snowfall.
We can only hope for warmer times...
Guards are patrolling the trade routes
Bandits have been seen on the trade routes
The firm taxation put on trade has upset the merchants so greatly that they have decided to take another route
I inform you that our policy of taxing the trade has upset the merchants.

While protecting the trade with the little amount of men my liege has given to me, a group of merchants approach me and ask for even more protection. These decissions are not for me to take however, I must ask my liege
I inform you that several merchants request more protection. They feel unsafe with the levy you provided me with.
I have send more than enough men already
